title: Fixing 3 Common Problems with Drip Irrigation

subtasks: Checking for clogged drip irrigation
Locating and replacing faulty emitters

Securing drip tubing with landscape staples

tasks.task: Extending and splitting a drip irrigation system
Troubleshooting a clogged drip irrigation system
Extending and splitting the drip irrigation system
MAINTASK: Troubleshooting a clogged drip irrigation system
subtasks: Checking for water flow through the drip line
Identifying the blocked area (e.g., a specific pot or section of the line)
Trimming faulty parts of the tubing (using shears or scissors)
Splicing new tubing and emitters to replace the faulty section
Identifying signs of overwatering (e.g., wilting despite adequate water)
Drilling drainage holes in the plant’s pot to improve water drainage

tasks.task: Extending and splitting a drip irrigation system
subtasks: Trenching a new drip line path
Splicing the new drip line into an existing section
Connecting the new drip line to the irrigation system
Covering the new tubing with soil to secure it in place
Turning adjustable emitters to increase or decrease water output as needed
